thread.title: Northern lights visible in Connecticut Thursday night
thread.title_full: Northern lights visible in Connecticut Thursday night

author: Sean Humphrey
title: Northern lights visible in Connecticut Thursday night
text: CONNECTICUT, USA — Connecticut residents spotted[ northern lights](https://www.fox61.com/article/weather/forecast/hartford-new-haven-waterbury-weather-forecast-connecticut/520-cd57cf5f-9021-4c36-b4cf-240ec23a4557) Thursday evening, resulting from a [severe solar storm](https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/communities/aurora-dashboard-experimental). According to FOX61 Meteorologist Rachel Frank, Thursday's visibility of the aurora borealis is a product of plasma and charged particles launched from the Sun into the Earth's atmosphere, resulting from a geomagnetic storm. The aurora could best be seen in places away from city lights and with a view of the northern horizon. Long-exposure cameras also helped capture the lights. Viewers from towns across Connecticut submitted their photos of the aurora: Northern lights visible in Connecticut Thursday night The northern lights could also be seen from UConn: RELATED: --- Do you have a story idea or something on your mind you want to share?
